briefdescription.para: State function of vehicle undergoing acceleration.
State function of main body exerting acceleration (e.g. Earth for an Earth-orbiting satellite).

detaileddescription.para: State function of large body primarily responsible for motion of central body (e.g. Sun for acceleration acting on an Earth-orbiting satellite).

briefdescription.para: Function returning the gravitational parameter of the central body.
Function returning the gravitational parameter of the primary body.
Name of primary body (e.g. Sun for acceleration acting on an Earth-orbiting satellite)
Function returning the angular momenum of the central body (expressed in the propagation frame)
Function returning the PPN parameter gamma.
Function returning the PPN parameter beta.
Current state of the body undergoing acceleration, as computed by last call to updateMembers function.
Current state of the main body exerting acceleration, as computed by last call to updateMembers function.
Current state of the primary body, as computed by last call to updateMembers function.
Current gravitational parameter of central body.
Current gravitational parameter of primary body.
Current angulat momentum vector of central body.
Current PPN parameter gamma.
Current PPN parameter beta.
Pre-computed common term for corrections (computed by calculateRelativisticAccelerationCorrectionsCommonterm)
Boolean denoting wheter the Schwarzschild term is used.
Boolean denoting wheter the de Sitter term is used.
Boolean denoting wheter the Lense-Thirring term is used.
Relativistic acceleration correction, as computed by last call to updateMembers function.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::function< Eigen::Vector6d() > stateFunctionOfAcceleratedBody, std::function< Eigen::Vector6d() > stateFunctionOfCentralBody, std::function< Eigen::Vector6d() > stateFunctionOfPrimaryBody, std::function< double() > gravitationalParameterFunctionOfCentralBody, std::function< double() > gravitationalParameterFunctionOfPrimaryBody, std::string primaryBodyName, std::function< Eigen::Vector3d() > centalBodyAngularMomentumFunction=std::function< Eigen::Vector3d() >(), std::function< double() > ppnParameterGammaFunction=[](){ return 1.0;}, std::function< double() > ppnParameterBetaFunction=[](){ return 1.0;}, const bool calculateSchwarzschildCorrection=true)
memberdef.name: RelativisticAccelerationCorrection

briefdescription.para: Constructor, used when including deSitter acceleration.

detaileddescription.para:
Constructor, used when including deSitter acceleration
stateFunctionOfAcceleratedBody
State function of vehicle undergoing acceleration
stateFunctionOfCentralBody
State function of main body exerting acceleration (e.g. Earth for an Earth-orbiting satellite).
stateFunctionOfPrimaryBody
State function of large body primarily responsible for motion of central body (e.g. Sun for acceleration acting on an Earth-orbiting satellite).
gravitationalParameterFunctionOfCentralBody
Function returning the gravitational parameter of the central body
gravitationalParameterFunctionOfPrimaryBody
Function returning the gravitational parameter of the primary body
primaryBodyName
Name of primary body (e.g. Sun for acceleration acting on an Earth-orbiting satellite)
centalBodyAngularMomentumFunction
Function returning the angular momenum of the central body, expressed in the propagation frame (default empty; no Lense-Thirring acceleration if empty).
ppnParameterGammaFunction
Function returning the PPN parameter gamma (default 1)
ppnParameterBetaFunction
Function returning the PPN parameter beta (default 1)
calculateSchwarzschildCorrection
Boolean denoting whether the schwarzschild term is to be used.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::function< Eigen::Vector6d() > stateFunctionOfAcceleratedBody, std::function< Eigen::Vector6d() > stateFunctionOfCentralBody, std::function< double() > gravitationalParameterFunctionOfCentralBody, std::function< Eigen::Vector3d() > centalBodyAngularMomentumFunction, std::function< double() > ppnParameterGammaFunction=[](){ return 1.0;}, std::function< double() > ppnParameterBetaFunction=[](){ return 1.0;}, const bool calculateSchwarzschildCorrection=true)
memberdef.name: RelativisticAccelerationCorrection

briefdescription.para: Constructor, used when including Lense-Thirring, but not de Sitter, acceleration.

detaileddescription.para:
Constructor, used when including Lense-Thirring, but not de Sitter, acceleration
stateFunctionOfAcceleratedBody

gravitationalParameterFunctionOfCentralBody
Function returning the gravitational parameter of the central body
centalBodyAngularMomentumFunction
Function returning the angular momenum of the central body, expressed in the propagation frame (default empty; no Lense-Thirring acceleration if empty).
ppnParameterGammaFunction
Function returning the PPN parameter gamma (default 1)
ppnParameterBetaFunction
Function returning the PPN parameter beta (default 1)
calculateSchwarzschildCorrection
Boolean denoting whether the schwarzschild term is to be used.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::function< Eigen::Vector6d() > stateFunctionOfAcceleratedBody, std::function< Eigen::Vector6d() > stateFunctionOfCentralBody, std::function< double() > gravitationalParameterFunctionOfCentralBody, std::function< double() > ppnParameterGammaFunction=[](){ return 1.0;}, std::function< double() > ppnParameterBetaFunction=[](){ return 1.0;})

briefdescription.para: Destructor.
Function to return the current acceleration.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the relativistic correction acceleration. Value is computed by updateMembers function
Acceleration.

briefdescription.para: Update member variables used by the relativistic correction acceleration model.

detaileddescription.para:
Updates member variables used by the relativistic correction acceleration model. Function pointers to retrieve the current values of quantities from which the acceleration is to be calculated are set by constructor. This function calls them to update the associated variables to their current state.
currentTime
Time at which acceleration model is to be updated.

briefdescription.para: Class to compute typical relativistic corrections to the dynamics of an orbiter.

detaileddescription.para: Class to compute typical relativistic corrections to the dynamics of an orbiter. The model allows the inclusion of the Schwarzschild, Lense-Thirring and de Sitter terms (any one of them may be turned on and off). An excellent introduction to these models is given in 'General relativity and Space Geodesy' by L. Combrinck (2012).
